summary: Provides a collection of low-level geometric utilities for handling great-circle arcs on a spherical Earth model, including calculations of arc length, extreme latitudes, point-in-arc tests, and related helper operations used by the grid subsystem.
business_intent: Enable accurate spherical geometry computations required for building, analyzing, and visualizing unstructured geospatial grids, such as determining distances, clipping arcs, and assessing spatial relationships on the globe.
